option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
""" Debug script to understand PyOxigraph QuerySolution behavior """ from pyoxigraph import Store, RdfFormat
# Load small sample store = Store()
print("Loading data...") with open("output/output_data_star.trig", 'rb') as f: store.load(f, RdfFormat.TRIG)
print(f"Loaded {len(list(store))} quads\n")
# Test query query = """ PREFIX dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?dataset ?title WHERE { ?dataset a dcat:Dataset ; dct:title ?title . } LIMIT 3 """
print("Executing query...") results = list(store.query(query)) print(f"Got {len(results)} results\n")
if results: first = results[0]
print(f"Type of result: {type(first)}") print(f"Result repr: {repr(first)}") print(f"Result str: {str(first)}")
print("\n--- Testing dictionary access ---") try: dataset = first['dataset'] print(f"✓ first['dataset'] = {dataset}") print(f" Type: {type(dataset)}") print(f" Str: {str(dataset)}") except Exception as e: print(f"✗ Dictionary access failed: {e}")
print("\n--- Testing iteration ---") try: print("Iterating over result:") for item in first: print(f" Item: {item} (type: {type(item)})") except Exception as e: print(f"✗ Iteration failed: {e}")
print("\n--- Testing dir() ---") methods = [m for m in dir(first) if not m.startswith('_')] print(f"Available methods: {methods}")
print("\n--- Trying different access methods ---")
# Try __iter__ try: print("Using __iter__:") for var in first: print(f" Variable: {var}") value = first[var] print(f" Value: {value}") print(f" Value type: {type(value)}") print(f" Value str: {str(value)}") except Exception as e: print(f"✗ __iter__ failed: {e}")
print("\n--- All results ---") for i, result in enumerate(results): print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") try: for var in result: value = result[var] print(f" {var} = {value}") except Exception as e: print(f" Error: {e}")
else: print("No results returned!")

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
""" Find how to get variable names from QuerySolutions """ from pyoxigraph import Store, RdfFormat
store = Store() with open("output/output_data_star.trig", 'rb') as f: store.load(f, RdfFormat.TRIG)
query = """ PREFIX dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?dataset ?title ?issued WHERE { ?dataset a dcat:Dataset ; dct:title ?title ; dct:issued ?issued . } LIMIT 3 """
print("Executing query...") query_results = store.query(query)
print(f"Type of query_results: {type(query_results)}") print(f"Query results: {query_results}")
# Check if it has variables method print(f"\ndir(query_results): {[m for m in dir(query_results) if not m.startswith('_')]}")
# Try to get variables if hasattr(query_results, 'variables'): print(f"\n✓ Has .variables property!") vars = query_results.variables # Property, not method! print(f"Variables: {vars}") print(f"Variable types: {[type(v) for v in vars]}") print(f"Variable strings: {[str(v) for v in vars]}")
# Convert to list and try first result results_list = list(query_results) print(f"\nGot {len(results_list)} results")
if results_list: first = results_list[0] print(f"\nFirst result type: {type(first)}")
# Try accessing by string print("\n--- Access by string key ---") for var_name in ['dataset', 'title', 'issued']: try: value = first[var_name] print(f"✓ first['{var_name}'] = {value}") except Exception as e: print(f"✗ first['{var_name}'] failed: {e}")
